comment:
* Contains received cell broadcast messages. More details are available in 3GPP TS 23.041.
     * @hide

variables.name: CONTENT_URI
variables.comment:
* The {@code content://} URI for this table.
         * Only privileged framework components running on phone or network stack uid can
         * query or modify this table.

variables.name: MESSAGE_HISTORY_URI
variables.comment:
* The {@code content://} URI for query cellbroadcast message history. * query results include following entries *
    *
  • {@link #_ID}
    • *
  • {@link #SLOT_INDEX}
    • *
  • {@link #GEOGRAPHICAL_SCOPE}
    • *
  • {@link #PLMN}
    • *
  • {@link #LAC}
    • *
  • {@link #CID}
    • *
  • {@link #SERIAL_NUMBER}
    • *
  • {@link #SERVICE_CATEGORY}
    • *
  • {@link #LANGUAGE_CODE}
    • *
  • {@link #MESSAGE_BODY}
    • *
  • {@link #DELIVERY_TIME}
    • *
  • {@link #MESSAGE_READ}
    • *
  • {@link #MESSAGE_FORMAT}
    • *
  • {@link #MESSAGE_PRIORITY}
    • *
  • {@link #ETWS_WARNING_TYPE}
    • *
  • {@link #CMAS_MESSAGE_CLASS}
    • *
  • {@link #CMAS_CATEGORY}
    • *
  • {@link #CMAS_RESPONSE_TYPE}
    • *
  • {@link #CMAS_SEVERITY}
    • *
  • {@link #CMAS_URGENCY}
    • *
  • {@link #CMAS_CERTAINTY}
    • *

variables.name: AUTHORITY_LEGACY
variables.comment:
* The authority for the legacy cellbroadcast provider.
         * This is used for OEM data migration. OEMs want to migrate message history or
         * sharepreference data to mainlined cellbroadcastreceiver app, should have a
         * contentprovider with authority: cellbroadcast-legacy. Mainlined cellbroadcastreceiver
         * will interact with this URI to retrieve data and persists to mainlined cellbroadcast app.
         *
         * @hide

variables.name: AUTHORITY_LEGACY_URI
variables.comment:
* A content:// style uri to the authority for the legacy cellbroadcast provider.
         * @hide

variables.name: CALL_METHOD_GET_PREFERENCE
variables.comment:
* Method name to {@link android.content.ContentProvider#call(String, String, Bundle) * for {@link #AUTHORITY_LEGACY}. Used to query cellbroadcast {@link Preference}, * containing following supported entries *
    *
  • {@link #ENABLE_AREA_UPDATE_INFO_PREF}
    • *
  • {@link #ENABLE_TEST_ALERT_PREF}
    • *
  • {@link #ENABLE_STATE_LOCAL_TEST_PREF}
    • *
  • {@link #ENABLE_PUBLIC_SAFETY_PREF}
    • *
  • {@link #ENABLE_CMAS_AMBER_PREF}
    • *
  • {@link #ENABLE_CMAS_SEVERE_THREAT_PREF}
    • *
  • {@link #ENABLE_CMAS_EXTREME_THREAT_PREF}
    • *
  • {@link #ENABLE_CMAS_PRESIDENTIAL_PREF}
    • *
  • {@link #ENABLE_ALERT_VIBRATION_PREF}
    • *
  • {@link #ENABLE_EMERGENCY_PERF}
    • *
  • {@link #ENABLE_CMAS_IN_SECOND_LANGUAGE_PREF}
    • *
* @hide

variables.name: SUBSCRIPTION_ID
variables.comment:
* The subscription which received this cell broadcast message. *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: SLOT_INDEX
variables.comment:
* The slot which received this cell broadcast message. *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: GEOGRAPHICAL_SCOPE
variables.comment:
* Message geographical scope. Valid values are: *
    *
  • {@link android.telephony.SmsCbMessage#GEOGRAPHICAL_SCOPE_CELL_WIDE}. meaning the * message is for the radio service cell
    • *
  • {@link android.telephony.SmsCbMessage#GEOGRAPHICAL_SCOPE_CELL_WIDE_IMMEDIATE}, * meaning the message is for the radio service cell and immediately displayed
    • *
  • {@link android.telephony.SmsCbMessage#GEOGRAPHICAL_SCOPE_PLMN_WIDE}, meaning the * message is for the PLMN (i.e. MCC/MNC)
    • *
  • {@link android.telephony.SmsCbMessage#GEOGRAPHICAL_SCOPE_LOCATION_AREA_WIDE}, * meaning the message is for the location area (in GSM) or service area (in UMTS)
    • *
* *

A message meant for a particular scope is automatically dismissed when the device * exits that scope.

*

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: SERIAL_NUMBER
variables.comment:
* Message serial number. *

* A 16-bit integer which identifies a particular CBS (cell * broadcast short message service) message. The core network is responsible for * allocating this value, and the value may be managed cyclically (3GPP TS 23.041 section * 9.2.1) once the serial message has been incremented a sufficient number of times. *

*

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: PLMN
LAC
variables.comment:
* Location area code (LAC). *

Code representing location area (GSM) or service area (UMTS) of broadcast sender. * Unused for CDMA. Only included if Geographical Scope of message is not PLMN wide (01). * This value is sent by the network based on the cell tower. *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: CID
variables.comment:
* Cell ID of message sender (GSM/UMTS). Unused for CDMA. Only included when the * Geographical Scope of message is cell wide (00 or 11). *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: SERVICE_CATEGORY
variables.comment:
* Service category which represents the general topic of the message. *

* For GSM/UMTS: message identifier (see 3GPP TS 23.041 section 9.4.1.2.2) * For CDMA: a 16-bit CDMA service category (see 3GPP2 C.R1001-D section 9.3) *

*

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: LANGUAGE_CODE
variables.comment:
* Message language code. (See 3GPP TS 23.041 section 9.4.1.2.3 for details). *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: DATA_CODING_SCHEME
variables.comment:
* Dats coding scheme of the message. *

* The data coding scheme (dcs) value defined in 3GPP TS 23.038 section 4 *

*

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: MESSAGE_BODY
variables.comment:
* Message body. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: DELIVERY_TIME
variables.comment:
* Message delivery time. *

This value is a system timestamp using {@link System#currentTimeMillis}

*

Type: INTEGER (long)

variables.name: MESSAGE_READ
variables.comment:
* Has the message been viewed? *

Type: INTEGER (boolean)

variables.name: MESSAGE_FORMAT
variables.comment:
* Message format ({@link android.telephony.SmsCbMessage#MESSAGE_FORMAT_3GPP} or * {@link android.telephony.SmsCbMessage#MESSAGE_FORMAT_3GPP2}). *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: MESSAGE_PRIORITY
variables.comment:
* Message priority. *

This includes *

    *
  • {@link android.telephony.SmsCbMessage#MESSAGE_PRIORITY_NORMAL}
    • *
  • {@link android.telephony.SmsCbMessage#MESSAGE_PRIORITY_INTERACTIVE}
    • *
  • {@link android.telephony.SmsCbMessage#MESSAGE_PRIORITY_URGENT}
    • *
  • {@link android.telephony.SmsCbMessage#MESSAGE_PRIORITY_EMERGENCY}
    • *

    *
*

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: ETWS_WARNING_TYPE
variables.comment:
* ETWS (Earthquake and Tsunami Warning System) warning type (ETWS alerts only). *

See {@link android.telephony.SmsCbEtwsInfo}

*

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: ETWS_IS_PRIMARY
variables.comment:
* ETWS (Earthquake and Tsunami Warning System) primary message or not (ETWS alerts only). *

See {@link android.telephony.SmsCbEtwsInfo}

*

Type: BOOLEAN

* * @hide // TODO: Unhide this for S.

variables.name: CMAS_MESSAGE_CLASS
variables.comment:
* CMAS (Commercial Mobile Alert System) message class (CMAS alerts only). *

See {@link android.telephony.SmsCbCmasInfo}

*

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: CMAS_CATEGORY
variables.comment:
* CMAS category (CMAS alerts only). *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: CMAS_RESPONSE_TYPE
variables.comment:
* CMAS response type (CMAS alerts only). *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: CMAS_SEVERITY
variables.comment:
* CMAS severity (CMAS alerts only). *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: CMAS_URGENCY
variables.comment:
* CMAS urgency (CMAS alerts only). *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: CMAS_CERTAINTY
variables.comment:
* CMAS certainty (CMAS alerts only). *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: DEFAULT_SORT_ORDER
variables.comment: The default sort order for this table.

variables.name: RECEIVED_TIME
variables.comment:
* The timestamp in millisecond, reported by {@link System#currentTimeMillis()}, when the * device received the message. *

Type: BIGINT

variables.name: LOCATION_CHECK_TIME
variables.comment:
* The timestamp in millisecond, reported by {@link System#currentTimeMillis()}, when * location was checked last time. Note this is only applicable to geo-targeting message. * For non geo-targeting message. the field will be set to -1. *

Type: BIGINT

variables.name: MESSAGE_BROADCASTED
variables.comment: TODO: deprecate this in S.

variables.name: MESSAGE_DISPLAYED
variables.comment:
* Indicates that whether the message has been displayed to the user. *

Type: BOOLEAN

variables.name: GEOMETRIES
variables.comment:
* The Warning Area Coordinates Elements. This element is used for geo-fencing purpose. * * The geometry and its coordinates are separated vertical bar, the first item is the * geometry type and the remaining items are the parameter of this geometry. * * Only circle and polygon are supported. The coordinates are represented in Horizontal * coordinates format. * * Coordinate encoding: * "latitude, longitude" * where -90.00000 <= latitude <= 90.00000 and -180.00000 <= longitude <= 180.00000 * * Polygon encoding: * "polygon|lat1,lng1|lat2,lng2|...|latn,lngn" * lat1,lng1 ... latn,lngn are the vertices coordinate of the polygon. * * Circle encoding: * "circle|lat,lng|radius". * lat,lng is the center of the circle. The unit of circle's radius is meter. * * Example: * "circle|0,0|100" mean a circle which center located at (0,0) and its radius is 100 meter. * "polygon|0,1.5|0,1|1,1|1,0" mean a polygon has vertices (0,1.5),(0,1),(1,1),(1,0). * * There could be more than one geometry store in this field, they are separated by a * semicolon. * * Example: * "circle|0,0|100;polygon|0,0|0,1.5|1,1|1,0;circle|100.123,100|200.123" * *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: MAXIMUM_WAIT_TIME
variables.comment:
* Geo-Fencing Maximum Wait Time in second. The range of the time is [0, 255]. A device * shall allow to determine its position meeting operator policy. If the device is unable to * determine its position meeting operator policy within the GeoFencing Maximum Wait Time, * it shall present the alert to the user and discontinue further positioning determination * for the alert. * *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: QUERY_COLUMNS
variables.comment:
* Query columns for instantiating com.android.cellbroadcastreceiver.CellBroadcastMessage.
         * @hide
